meanings.definition: To scatter or spread in drops or small particles.
meanings.sent1: She was splattering paint on the canvas.
meanings.sent2: The chef accidentally splattered sauce on the counter.
meanings.sent3: The kids had a splattering contest with water balloons.
meanings.sent4: The fireworks lit up the sky, splattering colors everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The rain was splattering against the window, creating a soothing sound.

meanings.definition: A mark or spot caused by splattering.
meanings.sent1: There was a splattering of mud on his shoes.
meanings.sent2: The artist admired the splattering of colors on the canvas.
meanings.sent3: The cake had a unique splattering of frosting on top.
meanings.sent4: The splattering of ink on the paper formed an interesting pattern.
meanings.sent5: The wall had a splattering of paint from the previous art project.

meanings.sent1: The splattering of rain on the roof was calming.
meanings.sent2: The chef listened to the splattering of oil in the pan.
meanings.sent3: The splattering of popcorn in the microwave made her hungry.
meanings.sent4: The splattering of waves against the shore was music to his ears.
meanings.sent5: The splattering of mud under their boots signaled the start of the hike.
